lines.text: [Charlie Brown is flying his kite, and as expected, lands it in the jaws of the Kite Eating Tree]
You stupid tree! If you don't stop biting my kite, I'll bite *you*!
[Naturally, the tree refuses to oblige, and continues to gorge on the kite]
All right... you asked for it!
[Grabs hold of the tree, opening his jaws]
[One second later, the tree stops biting as it feels a bite taken out of it]

[There is a hole in the tree in the shape of Charlie Brown's teeth]
Didn't think I'd do it, did ya?
[Makes a sinister grin-alas, no damage on his own teeth]
[Peppermint Patty continues to spread the news about the butterfly turning into an angel]

Hello, Joe Mel? I'm calling about something amazing that happened the other day. This butterfly landed on my nose, see? And while I was asleep, the butterfly turned into an angel and flew away and... Hello? Hello!
[Clicks phone hanger]
Joe Mel, hello? Hello? Hello?

[On the radio]
Oh sorry, folks. 'Just another nut calling in.
I'm not another nut!

[seeing the two golfers argue]
Look, Marcie! Mrs. Bartley's trying to push Mrs. Nelson's head into the ball washer. Look! Mrs. Nelson is stomping on Mrs. Bartley's feet with her golf shoes.
You know what worries me, sir? This is only a fourth hole!
Look! Mrs. Nelson is climbing the tree! She's climbing the tree to get away from Mrs. Bartley. Oh, I was wrong. She climbed the tree so she can jump on her.
Alright, you ladies, stop the fight! Here! Carry your own clubs!
[the golfers stop arguing]
I quit! And I want a dollar for the four holes I caddied, and I don't take credit cards!
What would you do if I were to snatch that blanket from you and throw it right into the trash burner?
I'd collapse right on the spot. They'd have to haul me away in an ambulance and place me in an oxygen tent.
[Lucy rushes out upon hearing this]
How do I think of things like that?
